00039 #define COMP_SECTION "[Comp]"

00058 /*
00059  * Write the file contents. The probe indicies are one based in the file.
00060  */
00061 bool CMSKFileWriter::Save()
00062 {
00063         m_strError = "";
00064 
00065         // Check if the array type has been set.
00066         if (m_strArrayType.length() == 0)
00067         {
00068                 m_strError = "The array type has not been set.";
00069                 return false;
00070         }
00071 
00072         // Open the mask file.
00073         ofstream outstream(m_strFileName.c_str(), ios::out);
00074         if (!outstream)
00075         {
00076                 m_strError = "Unable to create the mask file.";
00077                 return false;
00078         }
00079 
00080         // The first line is the array type
00081         outstream << m_strArrayType << endl;
00082 
00083         // Save the comp section.
00084         int size = (int) m_Sets.size();
00085         if (size > 0)
00086         {
00087                 outstream << endl << COMP_SECTION << endl;
00088                 for (list<string>::const_iterator it=m_Sets.begin(); it!=m_Sets.end(); ++it)
00089                 {
00090                         outstream << (*it) << endl;
00091                 }
00092         }
00093 
00094         // Save the call section.
00095         size = (int) m_Indicies.size();
00096         if (size > 0)
00097         {
00098                 outstream << endl << CALL_SECTION << endl;
00099                 for (ProbeSetIndiciesListConstIt it=m_Indicies.begin(); it!=m_Indicies.end(); ++it)
00100                 {
00101                         const ProbeSetIndiciesType &entry = *it;
00102                         outstream << entry.probeSetName << "\t";
00103                         int index=0;
00104                         size = (int) entry.indicies.size();
00105                         for (list<int>::const_iterator inIt=entry.indicies.begin(); inIt!=entry.indicies.end(); ++inIt)
00106                         {
00107                                 outstream << (*inIt) + 1;
00108                                 if (index < size-1)
00109                                         outstream << ",";
00110                                 ++index;
00111                         }
00112                         outstream << endl;
00113                 }
00114         }
00115 
00116         return true;
00117 }
